page.title: 19THE ROTTEN BOROUGH - REIGATE
page.content:
{Gatton Park}is famous as having been one of the "Rotten Boroughs" and was entitled to send two members to Parliament, but by l830 had only 7 electors. There is a small "Town Hall" still standing in the grounds.
Many{famous people}have owned Gatton including Sir Jeremiah Colman, the well known mustard manufacturer. During the Second World War the hall was used to billet Canadian Soldiers.
There was once an orphanage at Gatton Hall but since l955 it has been used as a {school,}known as the Royal Alexandra and Albert School. It is a boarding school for 532 children, many of whom come from service families.
